$eref.title: Job Title

___prop_acad_title.description: (FYI) With academic title and administrative title, these make up *business title* and are limited to 100 characthers if they are sent to Health Comp via Workday.
___prop_acad_title.title: Proposed Academic title

$eref.description: USC job code associated with job profile definition (type of job) (6 characters)
$eref.title: Job Code

_88authorized_by.description: ten digit department code driving security. Derived From Contract Department

___exh_a_addtl_text.title: Exhibit A additional terms, conditions, and aggrements

prop_admin_title.description: This is the administrative title that will appear on the faculty member's contract and there must be a current administrative appointment letter in the faculty memberâ€™s gold files.
prop_admin_title.title: Proposed administrative title

___prop_acad_title.description:
This is the title that will appear on the faculty member's contract and should include the correct name of endowed chairs, etc., and if multiple titles, list the named professorship or chair first. Please use proper case (upper and lower case) rather than all caps. Examples include:

  Professor of Biology
  Associate Professor of Chemical Engineering
  Assistant Professor of Medicine
  Associate Professor of Molecular Pharmacology & Toxicology
  Arthur Andersen Alumni Professor
  Dorothy W. Nelson Professor of Law
  Professor of Biomedical Engineering, Dwight C. and Hildagarde E. Baum Chair
  Henry Salvatori Chair in Computer Science
  Professor of Preventive Medicine and AFLAC, Incorporated, Chair in Cancer Research
___prop_acad_title.title: Proposed academic title

$eref.description: USC job code associated with job profile definition (type of job) (6 characters)
$eref.title: Job Code

_88reported_at.description: when contract data was reported from source

_88job_code.description: USC job code associated with job profile definition (type of job) (6 characters)
_88job_code.title: Job Code

_88job_title.description: the string description of a job code
_88job_title.title: Job Title

___chair_sig.description: Select either "Yes" or "No" to indicate whether or not to print the Department chair's signature on the Proposal/Contract.
___chair_sig.title: Chair's signature?

___dean_sig.description: Select either "Yes" or "No" to indicate whether or not to print the School dean's signature on the Proposal/Contract.
___dean_sig.title: Dean's signature?

___assignment.description: Specify the type of activity for which this proposal applies: teaching, clinical, research, or a combination thereof.
___assignment.title: Assignment

___temporary.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" to indicate whether or not the Faculty member is a Temporary employee.
If "Yes" is selected, the following text will be printed in the Faculty member's Appointment Letter:
As you know, this is a part-time, temporary assignment for the stated period only and the appointment is for a fixed term.
If "No" is selected, the following text will be printed in the Faculty member's Appointment Letter: As you know, this is a part-time assignment for the stated period only and the appointment is for a fixed term.
___temporary.title: Temporary

___indiv_instruction.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member will be paid for providing individual instruction. If you select "Yes", the following text will be printed in the Faculty member's Appointment Letter:
  If there is additional enrollment in the course, you will be paid for this additional work at the rate of @hourRate@ per student.
___indiv_instruction.title: Individual instruction?

___faculty_practice.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member has clinical practice plan income.
The following text will be printed if "Yes" is selected:

  As a faculty member, if after consultation with the chair or dean you engage in private practice, then you agree to conduct such practice solely under the terms and conditions of the appropriate school and departmental faculty practice plans.
___faculty_practice.title: Faculty practice?

___ext_funding.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member's compensation is supported by external funding in any amount.
The following text will be printed if "Yes" is selected:

  The external funding portion of your compensation is contingent upon the continued availability of such funds from external funding sources.
___ext_funding.title: External funding?

___office_hours.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member is expected to hold office hours. If you select "Yes", the following text will be printed in the Faculty member's Appointment Letter:

  As part of the assignment, you will be expected to schedule office hours at times that are convenient to students and participate in regularly scheduled meetings of the appropriate committees.
___office_hours.title: Office hours?

___retired.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member was retired and has been recalled to duty.
If "Yes" is selected, the following text will be printed on the Faculty member's Appointment Letter:

  We appreciate your willingness to accept this responsibility, after your retirement from the faculty. During this appointment, your title will continue to be @jobTitle@, though of course without tenure, and when this appointment concludes you will resume your retired status and title. Retired faculty who agree to be recalled to service make an enormous contribution to the departments programs. Thank you for all your efforts. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.
  If "No" is selected, the following text will be printed on the Faculty member's Appointment Letter:
  Our part-time faculty make an enormous contribution to the department's programs. Thank you for all your efforts. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.
___retired.title: Retired or recalled to duty?

___suff_enrollment.description: Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member's full salary is contingent upon sufficient enrollment for a course to be taught. If you select "Yes", the following text will be printed in the Faculty member's Appointment Letter: This appointment is contingent upon there being sufficient enrollment to warrant all sections of courses now scheduled. If the school decides to cancel your course(s) for any reason, we will let you know as soon as possible, and you will be paid for any sessions taught.
___suff_enrollment.title: Sufficient enrollment?

___early_term.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member is subject to early termination. This is only for Faculty members on multi-year appointments. If "Yes" is selected, the following text will be printed on the Faculty member's Appointment Letter:

  Since your compensation is funded by external sources, your appointment may be terminated early, on 90 days notice, if there is a reduction or discontinuation of the funding.

  Also, you will need to include the following statement in the "Additional Terms, Conditions, Agreements" field:

    "This appointment is part of a multi-year appointment until [date], subject to the terms of this letter."
___early_term.title: Early termination?

___con_curriculum.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member is expected to follow a consistent curriculum in his/her course instruction. If you select "Yes", the following text will be printed in the Faculty member's Appointment Letter:

  The degree program's curriculum is designed to provide integrated and sequential learning. It is important, therefore, that you confer with the head of the area to which you are assigned in order to insure that what you teach is consistent with the department's educational goals.
___con_curriculum.title: Consistent Curriculum

___addl_support.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member will be receiving additional support. If you select "Yes", the following text will be printed in the Faculty member's Appointment Letter:

  Assignments of space, equipment, clerical, and other support, as well as stipends and overload payments, are subject to change at the sole discretion of the chair or dean.
___addl_support.title: Additional support

___vac_benefits.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member is eligible for vacation benefits. This is only for Faculty members who work 12 months. If you select "Yes", the following text will be printed in the Faculty member's Appointment Letter:

  You accrue vacation benefits at a rate of four weeks per year (20 days), up to a total of no more than seven weeks (35 days), which must be taken at a mutually agreed upon time that does not conflict with your faculty responsibilities. After you accrue seven weeks, you will not accrue additional vacation eligibility until you have taken your accrued vacation. As a part-time faculty member working less than 100%, your rate of accrual is pro-rated based on the percentage of time worked.
___vac_benefits.title: Vacation benefits?

_88contract_status.description: An ordered set of statuses. When in alpha ascending, the first status is further along the process.
_88contract_status.title: Contract Status

___prop_contr_months.description: Choose the appropriate number of months for which core salary is earned; this does not include the period when summer stipend money is being paid. The number of months the contract covers should be for the actual number of months the faculty member is working (or on leave or sabbatical), not the number of months the faculty member's pay is spread over. For example, a faculty member who works from 8/16/2014 to 5/15/2015 prefers to have his pay spread over 12 months. His contract months would still only be 9 months and the beginning and ending dates should be consistent with the 9-month period.
___prop_contr_months.title: Proposed contract months (duration)

___contract_amend_date.description:
For a continuing contract, the amendment effective date of the first contract of the academic/fiscal year is the Contract Begin Date.
For mid-term contract amendments, the amendment effective date is the date of entry.
For new hires, the amendment effective date is the date the Contract Begin Date.
___contract_amend_date.title: Amendment Effective Date

___cont_begin_date.description: The format is mm/dd/yyyy. The 9-month faculty contract period usually is 08/16/XXXX to 05/15/XXXX, and the 12-month faculty contract period usually is 07/01/XXXX to 06/30/XXXX. The contract dates should cover the period when the faculty member is working, on sabbatical or on leave. For example, if a faculty member works from 08/16/2001 to 05/15/2002 but prefers to have his pay spread over 12 months, his contract dates would still be 08/16/2001 to 05/15/2002. Faculty on academic year appointments will hereafter receive pay beginning with one-half month's pay on August 26.
___cont_begin_date.title: Contract begin date

___date_fix_term.description: Faculty whose Reappointment Status is Fixed Term are required to have a date in this field. The date is the usually same date as the Contract End Date and the format is mm/dd/yyyy. There are cases where the School may wish to appoint a faculty member for a term longer than one year and provide a new contract reflecting the updated salary each year.
___date_fix_term.title: Date fixed term employment ends

enum_titles: 11235 KSOM NTT Clin Fac Core PCPP
11900 KSOM TT CLINICAL FAC ACA CORE

___course_obj_code.description: the budget object code the describes this assignment's pay
___course_obj_code.title: Course object code

___course_pay.description: Enter the compensation amount (US dollars) for teaching this course, doing this assignment.
___course_pay.title: Course pay

___assign_number.description: Use to connect this assignment to a workday compensation plan and t2(time keeping) (Assignment 10 is depricated)
___assign_number.title: Assignment number

___course_position_id.description: The workday position id for this person's work in this assignment. Should be only one option for faculty.
___course_position_id.title: Course position id

___course_job_code.description: the job code for the faculty doing the work assignment
___course_job_code.title: Course job code

___course_hrly_rate.description: amount in dollars (US) to be paid per hour worked
___course_hrly_rate.title: Course hourly rate

___course_begin_date.description: Should occur before the first day the person starts work (i.e. enters hours in time keeping system)
___course_begin_date.title: Course begin date

___primary_dept.description: First academic department. The department of the faculty's chair in governance structure.
___primary_dept.title: Primary department (academic)

___contract_dept.description: The department the manages the employment agreement. Administrative.
___contract_dept.title: Contract department (business)

___reappoint_status.description:
Select a reappointment status:
  Fixed Term (F):
    Select this if the Proposed Faculty Status is "Special" or "Voluntary."
  Notice of Non-reappointment Required (NR):
    Select this if the Proposed Faculty Status is "Probationary."
  Tenured (T):
    Select this if the Proposed Faculty Status is "Tenured".
___reappoint_status.title: Reappointment status

___non_reappt_date.description:
A Non-Reappointment Date is required if Reappointment Status is "Notice of Non-reappointment Required."
According to the Faculty Handbook section 4-F, in the case of non-reappointment of a tenure-track faculty member, the faculty member shall receive notice of non-reappointment in writing as follows: (1) not later than February 15 of the first academic year of service; (2) not later than November 15 of the second academic year of service; (3) at least twelve months before the expiration of an appointment after two or more years at the university.
In the case of non-reappointment of a non-tenured faculty member, refer to section 4-G of the Faculty Handbook and the Provostâ€™s memos on the Procedures for Considering Non-Reappointment of Non-Tenure Track Faculty.
___non_reappt_date.title: Non reappointment date

___ten_dec_date.description:
A tenure decision date is required for all probationary (tenure track) faculty members.
According to the Faculty Handbook, this date takes into account the number of years of full-time tenure-track service at other institutions and the date before which a decision on tenure must be made at the University of Southern California, which is 12 months before the expiration of the stated probationary period.
The probationary period shall not exceed twelve years beginning with the faculty member's first full-time tenure- track appointment in an institution of higher education except as noted in subsections 4-D (1) of the Faculty Handbook
The letter of appointment for each new faculty member must specify the Tenure Decision Date, which will be determined by the length of the school-specific maximum probationary period and any credit accorded for full-time tenure-, continuous, prior service. A signed copy of the faculty member's acceptance must be filed with the appropriate vice-president. Unresolved questions concerning what prior service must or must not be counted, and other matters pertaining to the length of the probationary period, shall be directed to the Committee on Probationary Deadlines for its review and recommendations to the President.
Extensions of the tenure decision date and exceptions to this policy require the Provost's approval; direct such requests to the Committee on Probationary Deadlines for its review and recommendations.
The annual letter of reappointment/contract for each probationary faculty member shall incorporate the Tenure Decision Date, reflecting any adjustments that may have been approved during the prior year. type: string format: date
___ten_dec_date.title: Tenure decision date

___date_tenured.description: Date committe met and made decision regarding tenure
___date_tenured.title: Date tenured

___prop_fte_base_rate.title: Proposed full time equivalent core earnings (Core / FTE)

___prop_curr_pct.desciption: This defaults to the current percent. But if the faculty member is changing workload, a new percent of time will need to be entered. Enter only numbers between 1 and 100 with no decimals, percent signs or other characters. This percent represents the percent of salary the faculty member will be receiving, for example, if a faculty member is only going to receive 50% of full time pay, then the percent should be 50%. If the faculty member will be on leave and will receive no salary, the percent should be 0%.
___prop_curr_pct.title: Proposed percent of full time equivalent

___wd_awp.desciption: FIXME: to enumerate AWP for next year via $ref service
___wd_awp.title: Workday Academic Work Period (AWP)

___prop_pct_efrt.desciption: The percent of effort is the percent of time worked, based on a 40-hour work week. For all tenure-track and tenured faculty, the percent of effort is 100%. For non-tenure track faculty, the percent of effort is the same as the % of FTE unless the non-tenure track faculty is granted a school paid leave. Remember, that there are no changes in the % Effort for faculty on medical or statutory leaves.
___prop_pct_efrt.title: Proposed percent effort

___hour_rate.description: Core compensation divided by hours per week
___hour_rate.title: Hourly rate

enum_titles: 11235 KSOM NTT Clin Fac Core PCPP
11900 KSOM TT CLINICAL FAC ACA CORE
11905 KSOM NTT CLIN FAC ACA CORE

___prop_act_base_pay.description: Enter the actual total core pay, including sabbatical pay, the faculty member will receive for the entire contract period. Core pay does not include stipends, overloads, summer research pay, etc. Annual FTE core should not be entered here. For example, if the faculty member is 75% time during the contract period and will be paid $80,000 for this workload, the amount entered in this field is 80000. If a faculty member will work only 4.5 months and will be paid $22,500 for the 4.5 months, enter 22500 in this field.
___prop_act_base_pay.title: Proposed Actual Annual Core Pay

___contract_amend_date.description:
For a continuing contract, the amendment effective date of the first contract of the academic/fiscal year is the Contract Begin Date.
For mid-term contract amendments, the amendment effective date is the date of entry.
For new hires, the amendment effective date is the date the Contract Begin Date.
___contract_amend_date.title: Amendment Effective Date

___cont_begin_date.description: The format is mm/dd/yyyy. The 9-month faculty contract period usually is 08/16/XXXX to 05/15/XXXX, and the 12-month faculty contract period usually is 07/01/XXXX to 06/30/XXXX. The contract dates should cover the period when the faculty member is working, on sabbatical or on leave. For example, if a faculty member works from 08/16/2001 to 05/15/2002 but prefers to have his pay spread over 12 months, his contract dates would still be 08/16/2001 to 05/15/2002. Faculty on academic year appointments will hereafter receive pay beginning with one-half month's pay on August 26.

___date_fix_term.title: Date fixed term employment ends

___reappoint_status.description:
Select a reappointment status:
  Fixed Term (F):
    Select this if the Proposed Faculty Status is "Special" or "Voluntary."
  Notice of Non-reappointment Required (NR):
    Select this if the Proposed Faculty Status is "Probationary."
  Tenured (T):
    Select this if the Proposed Faculty Status is "Tenured".
___reappoint_status.title: Reappointment status

___non_reappt_date.description:
A Non-Reappointment Date is required if Reappointment Status is "Notice of Non-reappointment Required."
According to the Faculty Handbook section 4-F, in the case of non-reappointment of a tenure-track faculty member, the faculty member shall receive notice of non-reappointment in writing as follows: (1) not later than February 15 of the first academic year of service; (2) not later than November 15 of the second academic year of service; (3) at least twelve months before the expiration of an appointment after two or more years at the university.
In the case of non-reappointment of a non-tenured faculty member, refer to section 4-G of the Faculty Handbook and the Provostâ€™s memos on the Procedures for Considering Non-Reappointment of Non-Tenure Track Faculty.
___non_reappt_date.title: Non reappointment date

___ten_dec_date.description:
A tenure decision date is required for all probationary (tenure track) faculty members.
According to the Faculty Handbook, this date takes into account the number of years of full-time tenure-track service at other institutions and the date before which a decision on tenure must be made at the University of Southern California, which is 12 months before the expiration of the stated probationary period.
The probationary period shall not exceed twelve years beginning with the faculty member's first full-time tenure- track appointment in an institution of higher education except as noted in subsections 4-D (1) of the Faculty Handbook
The letter of appointment for each new faculty member must specify the Tenure Decision Date, which will be determined by the length of the school-specific maximum probationary period and any credit accorded for full-time tenure-, continuous, prior service. A signed copy of the faculty member's acceptance must be filed with the appropriate vice-president. Unresolved questions concerning what prior service must or must not be counted, and other matters pertaining to the length of the probationary period, shall be directed to the Committee on Probationary Deadlines for its review and recommendations to the President.
Extensions of the tenure decision date and exceptions to this policy require the Provost's approval; direct such requests to the Committee on Probationary Deadlines for its review and recommendations.
The annual letter of reappointment/contract for each probationary faculty member shall incorporate the Tenure Decision Date, reflecting any adjustments that may have been approved during the prior year. type: string format: date
___ten_dec_date.title: Tenure decision date

___date_tenured.description: Date committe met and made decision regarding tenure
___date_tenured.title: Date tenured

___temporary.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" to indicate whether or not the Faculty member is a Temporary employee.
If "Yes" is selected, the following text will be printed in the Faculty member's Appointment Letter:
As you know, this is a part-time, temporary assignment for the stated period only and the appointment is for a fixed term.
If "No" is selected, the following text will be printed in the Faculty member's Appointment Letter: As you know, this is a part-time assignment for the stated period only and the appointment is for a fixed term.
___temporary.title: Temporary

___prop_acad_title.description: (FYI) With academic title and administrative title, these make up *business title* and are limited to 100 characthers if they are sent to Health Comp via Workday.
___prop_acad_title.title: Proposed Academic title

_88authorized_by.description: ten digit department code driving security. Derived From Contract Department

___exh_a_addtl_text.title: Exhibit A additional terms, conditions, and aggrements

prop_admin_title.description: This is the administrative title that will appear on the faculty member's contract and there must be a current administrative appointment letter in the faculty memberâ€™s gold files.
prop_admin_title.title: Proposed administrative title

___prop_acad_title.description:
This is the title that will appear on the faculty member's contract and should include the correct name of endowed chairs, etc., and if multiple titles, list the named professorship or chair first. Please use proper case (upper and lower case) rather than all caps. Examples include:

  Professor of Biology
  Associate Professor of Chemical Engineering
  Assistant Professor of Medicine
  Associate Professor of Molecular Pharmacology & Toxicology
  Arthur Andersen Alumni Professor
  Dorothy W. Nelson Professor of Law
  Professor of Biomedical Engineering, Dwight C. and Hildagarde E. Baum Chair
  Henry Salvatori Chair in Computer Science
  Professor of Preventive Medicine and AFLAC, Incorporated, Chair in Cancer Research
___prop_acad_title.title: Proposed academic title

_88reported_at.description: when contract data was reported from source

_88job_code.description: USC job code associated with job profile definition (type of job) (6 characters)
_88job_code.title: Job Code

_88job_title.description: the string description of a job code
_88job_title.title: Job Title

___chair_sig.description: Select either "Yes" or "No" to indicate whether or not to print the Department chair's signature on the Proposal/Contract.
___chair_sig.title: Chair's signature?

___dean_sig.description: Select either "Yes" or "No" to indicate whether or not to print the School dean's signature on the Proposal/Contract.
___dean_sig.title: Dean's signature?

___assignment.description: Specify the type of activity for which this proposal applies: teaching, clinical, research, or a combination thereof.
___assignment.title: Assignment

___temporary.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" to indicate whether or not the Faculty member is a Temporary employee.
If "Yes" is selected, the following text will be printed in the Faculty member's Appointment Letter:
As you know, this is a part-time, temporary assignment for the stated period only and the appointment is for a fixed term.
If "No" is selected, the following text will be printed in the Faculty member's Appointment Letter: As you know, this is a part-time assignment for the stated period only and the appointment is for a fixed term.
___temporary.title: Temporary

___indiv_instruction.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member will be paid for providing individual instruction. If you select "Yes", the following text will be printed in the Faculty member's Appointment Letter:
  If there is additional enrollment in the course, you will be paid for this additional work at the rate of @hourRate@ per student.
___indiv_instruction.title: Individual instruction?

___faculty_practice.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member has clinical practice plan income.
The following text will be printed if "Yes" is selected:

  As a faculty member, if after consultation with the chair or dean you engage in private practice, then you agree to conduct such practice solely under the terms and conditions of the appropriate school and departmental faculty practice plans.
___faculty_practice.title: Faculty practice?

___ext_funding.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member's compensation is supported by external funding in any amount.
The following text will be printed if "Yes" is selected:

  The external funding portion of your compensation is contingent upon the continued availability of such funds from external funding sources.
___ext_funding.title: External funding?

___office_hours.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member is expected to hold office hours. If you select "Yes", the following text will be printed in the Faculty member's Appointment Letter:

  As part of the assignment, you will be expected to schedule office hours at times that are convenient to students and participate in regularly scheduled meetings of the appropriate committees.
___office_hours.title: Office hours?

___retired.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member was retired and has been recalled to duty.
If "Yes" is selected, the following text will be printed on the Faculty member's Appointment Letter:

  We appreciate your willingness to accept this responsibility, after your retirement from the faculty. During this appointment, your title will continue to be @jobTitle@, though of course without tenure, and when this appointment concludes you will resume your retired status and title. Retired faculty who agree to be recalled to service make an enormous contribution to the departments programs. Thank you for all your efforts. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.
  If "No" is selected, the following text will be printed on the Faculty member's Appointment Letter:
  Our part-time faculty make an enormous contribution to the department's programs. Thank you for all your efforts. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.
___retired.title: Retired or recalled to duty?

___suff_enrollment.description: Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member's full salary is contingent upon sufficient enrollment for a course to be taught. If you select "Yes", the following text will be printed in the Faculty member's Appointment Letter: This appointment is contingent upon there being sufficient enrollment to warrant all sections of courses now scheduled. If the school decides to cancel your course(s) for any reason, we will let you know as soon as possible, and you will be paid for any sessions taught.
___suff_enrollment.title: Sufficient enrollment?

___early_term.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member is subject to early termination. This is only for Faculty members on multi-year appointments. If "Yes" is selected, the following text will be printed on the Faculty member's Appointment Letter:

  Since your compensation is funded by external sources, your appointment may be terminated early, on 90 days notice, if there is a reduction or discontinuation of the funding.

  Also, you will need to include the following statement in the "Additional Terms, Conditions, Agreements" field:

    "This appointment is part of a multi-year appointment until [date], subject to the terms of this letter."
___early_term.title: Early termination?

___con_curriculum.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member is expected to follow a consistent curriculum in his/her course instruction. If you select "Yes", the following text will be printed in the Faculty member's Appointment Letter:

  The degree program's curriculum is designed to provide integrated and sequential learning. It is important, therefore, that you confer with the head of the area to which you are assigned in order to insure that what you teach is consistent with the department's educational goals.
___con_curriculum.title: Consistent Curriculum

___addl_support.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member will be receiving additional support. If you select "Yes", the following text will be printed in the Faculty member's Appointment Letter:

  Assignments of space, equipment, clerical, and other support, as well as stipends and overload payments, are subject to change at the sole discretion of the chair or dean.
___addl_support.title: Additional support

___vac_benefits.description:
Select either "Yes" or "No" on whether or not the Faculty member is eligible for vacation benefits. This is only for Faculty members who work 12 months. If you select "Yes", the following text will be printed in the Faculty member's Appointment Letter:

  You accrue vacation benefits at a rate of four weeks per year (20 days), up to a total of no more than seven weeks (35 days), which must be taken at a mutually agreed upon time that does not conflict with your faculty responsibilities. After you accrue seven weeks, you will not accrue additional vacation eligibility until you have taken your accrued vacation. As a part-time faculty member working less than 100%, your rate of accrual is pro-rated based on the percentage of time worked.
___vac_benefits.title: Vacation benefits?

_88contract_status.description: An ordered set of statuses. When in alpha ascending, the first status is further along the process.
_88contract_status.title: Contract Status

___prop_contr_months.description: Choose the appropriate number of months for which core salary is earned; this does not include the period when summer stipend money is being paid. The number of months the contract covers should be for the actual number of months the faculty member is working (or on leave or sabbatical), not the number of months the faculty member's pay is spread over. For example, a faculty member who works from 8/16/2014 to 5/15/2015 prefers to have his pay spread over 12 months. His contract months would still only be 9 months and the beginning and ending dates should be consistent with the 9-month period.
___prop_contr_months.title: Proposed contract months (duration)

___contract_amend_date.description:
For a continuing contract, the amendment effective date of the first contract of the academic/fiscal year is the Contract Begin Date.
For mid-term contract amendments, the amendment effective date is the date of entry.
For new hires, the amendment effective date is the date the Contract Begin Date.
___contract_amend_date.title: Amendment Effective Date

___cont_begin_date.description: The format is mm/dd/yyyy. The 9-month faculty contract period usually is 08/16/XXXX to 05/15/XXXX, and the 12-month faculty contract period usually is 07/01/XXXX to 06/30/XXXX. The contract dates should cover the period when the faculty member is working, on sabbatical or on leave. For example, if a faculty member works from 08/16/2001 to 05/15/2002 but prefers to have his pay spread over 12 months, his contract dates would still be 08/16/2001 to 05/15/2002. Faculty on academic year appointments will hereafter receive pay beginning with one-half month's pay on August 26.
___cont_begin_date.title: Contract begin date

___date_fix_term.description: Faculty whose Reappointment Status is Fixed Term are required to have a date in this field. The date is the usually same date as the Contract End Date and the format is mm/dd/yyyy. There are cases where the School may wish to appoint a faculty member for a term longer than one year and provide a new contract reflecting the updated salary each year.
___date_fix_term.title: Date fixed term employment ends

___course_obj_code.description: the budget object code the describes this assignment's pay
___course_obj_code.title: Course object code

___course_pay.description: Enter the compensation amount (US dollars) for teaching this course, doing this assignment.
___course_pay.title: Course pay

___assign_number.description: Use to connect this assignment to a workday compensation plan and t2(time keeping) (Assignment 10 is depricated)
___assign_number.title: Assignment number

___course_position_id.description: The workday position id for this person's work in this assignment. Should be only one option for faculty.
___course_position_id.title: Course position id

___course_job_code.description: the job code for the faculty doing the work assignment
___course_job_code.title: Course job code

___course_hrly_rate.description: amount in dollars (US) to be paid per hour worked
___course_hrly_rate.title: Course hourly rate

___course_begin_date.description: Should occur before the first day the person starts work (i.e. enters hours in time keeping system)
___course_begin_date.title: Course begin date

___primary_dept.description: First academic department. The department of the faculty's chair in governance structure.
___primary_dept.title: Primary department (academic)

___contract_dept.description: The department the manages the employment agreement. Administrative.
___contract_dept.title: Contract department (business)

___reappoint_status.description:
Select a reappointment status:
  Fixed Term (F):
    Select this if the Proposed Faculty Status is "Special" or "Voluntary."
  Notice of Non-reappointment Required (NR):
    Select this if the Proposed Faculty Status is "Probationary."
  Tenured (T):
    Select this if the Proposed Faculty Status is "Tenured".
___reappoint_status.title: Reappointment status

___non_reappt_date.description:
A Non-Reappointment Date is required if Reappointment Status is "Notice of Non-reappointment Required."
According to the Faculty Handbook section 4-F, in the case of non-reappointment of a tenure-track faculty member, the faculty member shall receive notice of non-reappointment in writing as follows: (1) not later than February 15 of the first academic year of service; (2) not later than November 15 of the second academic year of service; (3) at least twelve months before the expiration of an appointment after two or more years at the university.
In the case of non-reappointment of a non-tenured faculty member, refer to section 4-G of the Faculty Handbook and the Provostâ€™s memos on the Procedures for Considering Non-Reappointment of Non-Tenure Track Faculty.
___non_reappt_date.title: Non reappointment date

___ten_dec_date.description:
A tenure decision date is required for all probationary (tenure track) faculty members.
According to the Faculty Handbook, this date takes into account the number of years of full-time tenure-track service at other institutions and the date before which a decision on tenure must be made at the University of Southern California, which is 12 months before the expiration of the stated probationary period.
The probationary period shall not exceed twelve years beginning with the faculty member's first full-time tenure- track appointment in an institution of higher education except as noted in subsections 4-D (1) of the Faculty Handbook
The letter of appointment for each new faculty member must specify the Tenure Decision Date, which will be determined by the length of the school-specific maximum probationary period and any credit accorded for full-time tenure-, continuous, prior service. A signed copy of the faculty member's acceptance must be filed with the appropriate vice-president. Unresolved questions concerning what prior service must or must not be counted, and other matters pertaining to the length of the probationary period, shall be directed to the Committee on Probationary Deadlines for its review and recommendations to the President.
Extensions of the tenure decision date and exceptions to this policy require the Provost's approval; direct such requests to the Committee on Probationary Deadlines for its review and recommendations.
The annual letter of reappointment/contract for each probationary faculty member shall incorporate the Tenure Decision Date, reflecting any adjustments that may have been approved during the prior year. type: string format: date
___ten_dec_date.title: Tenure decision date

___date_tenured.description: Date committe met and made decision regarding tenure
___date_tenured.title: Date tenured

___prop_fte_base_rate.title: Proposed full time equivalent core earnings (Core / FTE)

___prop_curr_pct.desciption: This defaults to the current percent. But if the faculty member is changing workload, a new percent of time will need to be entered. Enter only numbers between 1 and 100 with no decimals, percent signs or other characters. This percent represents the percent of salary the faculty member will be receiving, for example, if a faculty member is only going to receive 50% of full time pay, then the percent should be 50%. If the faculty member will be on leave and will receive no salary, the percent should be 0%.
___prop_curr_pct.title: Proposed percent of full time equivalent

___wd_awp.desciption: FIXME: to enumerate AWP for next year via $ref service
___wd_awp.title: Workday Academic Work Period (AWP)

___prop_pct_efrt.desciption: The percent of effort is the percent of time worked, based on a 40-hour work week. For all tenure-track and tenured faculty, the percent of effort is 100%. For non-tenure track faculty, the percent of effort is the same as the % of FTE unless the non-tenure track faculty is granted a school paid leave. Remember, that there are no changes in the % Effort for faculty on medical or statutory leaves.
___prop_pct_efrt.title: Proposed percent effort

___hour_rate.description: Core compensation divided by hours per week
___hour_rate.title: Hourly rate

___prop_act_base_pay.description: Enter the actual total core pay, including sabbatical pay, the faculty member will receive for the entire contract period. Core pay does not include stipends, overloads, summer research pay, etc. Annual FTE core should not be entered here. For example, if the faculty member is 75% time during the contract period and will be paid $80,000 for this workload, the amount entered in this field is 80000. If a faculty member will work only 4.5 months and will be paid $22,500 for the 4.5 months, enter 22500 in this field.
___prop_act_base_pay.title: Proposed Actual Annual Core Pay
